required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Open-Label, Dose Escalation Study of Quizartinib, An Oral FLT3 Inhibitor, in Japanese Patients With Relapsed or Refractory Acute Myeloid Leukemia

brief_summary.textblock: This is a dose escalation study to evaluate the safety, tolerability, and pharmacokinetics of quizartinib for Japanese acute myeloid leukemia (AML) subjects.

primary_outcome.measure: number of subjects experiencing adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: first dose to follow-up, approximately 1 year

primary_outcome.measure: Cmax of quizartinib and its active metabolite
primary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1: Days 1, 2, 4, 8, 11, 15, 16, 18, 22, 28; Cycle 2 and on: Days 1, 15
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate the pharmacokinetics of quizartinib and its active metabolite, AC886 by Cmax, Tmax, AUCtau, Cmax,ss, Ctrough, Tmax,ss, AUCtau,ss.

primary_outcome.measure: Tmax of quizartinib and its active metabolite
primary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1: Days 1, 2, 4, 8, 11, 15, 16, 18, 22, 28; Cycle 2 and on: Days 1, 15
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate the pharmacokinetics of quizartinib and its active metabolite, AC886 by Cmax, Tmax, AUCtau, Cmax,ss, Ctrough, Tmax,ss, AUCtau,ss.

primary_outcome.measure: AUCtau of quizartinib and its active metabolite

secondary_outcome.measure: FMS-like tyrosine kinase-3 / internal tandem duplication FLT3/ITD allelic ratio
secondary_outcome.description: Exploratory assessment of quizartinib-related biomarkers such as FLT3-ITD allelic ratio, PIA assessment.
Exploratory assessment of quizartinib-related biomarkers such as FLT3-ITD allelic ratio, PIA assessment.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1: Days 15, 28; Cycle 2 and on: Day 28
secondary_outcome.description: Exploratory analyses of tumor response to quizartinib based on bone marrow findings, absolute neutrophil count, and platelet count.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1: Days 15, 28; Cycle 2 and on: Day 28
secondary_outcome.description: Exploratory analyses of tumor response to quizartinib based on bone marrow findings, absolute neutrophil count, and platelet count.

secondary_outcome.description: Exploratory analyses of tumor response to quizartinib based on bone marrow findings, absolute neutrophil count, and platelet count.

arm_group.description: This study will follow a mCRM (modified continual reassessment method) + EWOC (Escalation with Overdose Control) design.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Relapsed or refractory AML
- AML for which no standard treatment is available
- ECOG Performance Status (PS) of 0 to 2
Exclusion Criteria:
- Acute Promyelocytic Leukemia
- chronic myelogenous leukemia in blast phase (BCR-ABL fusion gene positive)
- History of other malignancies within 3 years prior to enrollment, except curatively treated in-situ carcinoma, AML, or MDS.

patient_data.ipd_description: De-identified individual participant data (IPD) and applicable supporting clinical trial documents may be available upon request at https://vivli.org/. In cases where clinical trial data and supporting documents are provided pursuant to our company policies and procedures, Daiichi Sankyo will continue to protect the privacy of our clinical trial participants. Details on data sharing criteria and the procedure for requesting access can be found at this web address: https://vivli.org/ourmember/daiichi-sankyo/
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Studies for which the medicine and indication have received European Union (EU) and United States (US), and/or Japan (JP) marketing approval on or after 01 January 2014 or by the US or EU or JP Health Authorities when regulatory submissions in all regions are not planned and after the primary study results have been accepted for publication.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Formal request from qualified scientific and medical researchers on IPD and clinical study documents from clinical trials supporting products submitted and licensed in the United States, the European Union and/or Japan from 01 January 2014 and beyond for the purpose of conducting legitimate research. This must be consistent with the principle of safeguarding study participants' privacy and consistent with provision of informed consent.
